courseDetails.title: Aging and Geriatrics
courseDetails.shortDescription: Geriatric medicine
courseDetails.longDescription:
Aging is a gradual, continuous process of natural change that begins in early adulthood. During early middle age, many bodily functions begin to gradually decline.

People do not become old or elderly at any specific age. Traditionally, age 65 has been designated as the beginning of old age. But the reason was based in history, not biology. Many years ago, age 65 was chosen as the age for retirement in Germany, the first nation to establish a retirement program. In 1965 in the United States, age 65 was designated as the eligibility age for Medicare insurance. This age is close to the actual retirement age of most people in economically advanced societies.

When a person becomes old can be answered in different ways:

  • Chronologic age is based solely on the passage of time. It is a person’s age in years. Chronologic age has limited significance in terms of health. Nonetheless, the likelihood of developing a health problem increases as people age, and it is health problems, rather than normal aging, that are the primary cause of functional loss during old age. Because chronologic age helps predict many health problems, it has some legal and financial uses.

  • Biologic age refers to changes in the body that commonly occur as people age. Because these changes affect some people sooner than others, some people are biologically old at 65, and others not until a decade or more later. However, most noticeable differences in apparent age among people of similar chronologic age are caused by lifestyle, habit, and subtle effects of disease rather than by differences in actual aging.

  • Psychologic age is based on how people act and feel. For example, an 80-year-old who works, plans, looks forward to future events, and participates in many activities is considered psychologically younger.

Most healthy and active people do not need the expertise of a geriatrician (a doctor who specializes in the care of older people) until they are 70, 75, or even 80 years old. However, some people need to see a geriatrician at a younger chronologic age because of their medical conditions.

Normal aging

People often wonder whether what they are experiencing as they age is normal or abnormal. Although people age somewhat differently, some changes result from internal processes, that is, from aging itself. Thus, such changes, although undesired, are considered normal and are sometimes called "pure aging." These changes occur in everyone who lives long enough, and that universality is part of the definition of pure aging. The changes are to be expected and are generally unavoidable. For example, as people age, the lens of the eye thickens, stiffens, and becomes less able to focus on close objects, such as reading materials (a disorder called presbyopia). This change occurs in virtually all older people. Thus, presbyopia is considered normal aging. Other terms used to describe these changes are "usual aging" and "senescence."


exactly what constitutes normal aging is not always clear. Changes that occur with normal aging make people more likely to develop certain disorders. However, people can sometimes take actions to compensate for these changes. For example, older people are more likely to lose teeth. But seeing a dentist regularly, eating fewer sweets, and brushing and flossing regularly may reduce the chances of tooth loss. Thus, tooth loss, although common with aging, is an avoidable part of aging.

Also, functional decline that is part of aging sometimes seems similar to functional decline that is part of a disorder. For example, with advanced age, a mild decline in mental function is nearly universal and is considered normal aging. This decline includes increased difficulty learning new things such as languages, decreased attention span, and increased forgetfulness. In contrast, the decline that occurs in dementia is much more severe. For example, people who are aging normally may misplace things or forget details, but people who have dementia forget entire events. People with dementia also have difficulty doing normal daily tasks (such as driving, cooking, and handling finances) and understanding the environment, including knowing what year it is and where they are. Thus, dementia is considered a disorder, even though it is common later in life. Certain kinds of dementia, such as Alzheimer disease, differ from normal aging in other ways as well. For example, brain tissue (obtained during autopsy) in people with Alzheimer disease looks different from that in older people without the disease. So the distinction between normal aging and dementia is clear.

Sometimes the distinction between functional decline that is part of aging and functional decline that is part of a disorder seems arbitrary. For example, as people age, blood sugar levels increase more after eating carbohydrates than they do in younger people. This increase is considered normal aging. However, if the increase exceeds a certain level, diabetes, a disorder, is diagnosed. In this case, the difference is one of degree only.

Healthy (successful) aging

Healthy aging refers to postponement of or reduction in the undesired effects of aging. The goals of healthy aging are maintaining physical and mental health, avoiding disorders, and remaining active and independent. For most people, maintaining general good health requires more effort as they age. Developing certain healthy habits can help, such as

  • Following a nutritious diet

  • Avoiding cigarette smoking and excessive alcohol use

  • Exercising regularly

  • Staying mentally active

The sooner a person develops these habits, the better. However, it is never too late to begin. In this way, people can have some control over what happens to them as they age.

Some evidence suggests that in the United States, healthy aging is on the rise:

  • A decrease in the percentage of people aged 75 to 84 who report impairments

  • A decrease in the percentage of people over age 65 with debilitating disorders

  • An increase in the oldest old—people age 85 and older, including those who have reached 100 (centenarians)

Aging is a natural process of structural decay that all living organisms undergo. It is caused by intrinsic processes (e.g., genomic instability and telomeric attrition) and interactions with the environment (e.g., exposure to sunlight and toxins). As aging is related to and dependent upon living and interacting with the environment, it has been associated with chronology since antiquity.

as human beings get older, the aging process results in many organic changes that must be anticipated and differentiated by the physician from the actual manifestations of a disease. For example, deposition of materials in the arterioles over the years can slightly increase systemic vascular resistance and ultimately blood pressure. On the other hand, the processes related to aging can play a major role in the pathophysiology of degenerative conditions such as Alzheimer’s disease, Huntington’s disease, and Parkinsonism.

For optimal comprehension, the medical student should be familiarized with organelles and their functions, genome replication, epigenetics, the basics of stem cells, and intercellular communication.
targetAudiences: any one take care of older people    , Nurses ,Pharmacists , physician ,old people seeking advice

courseDetails.title: Diploma in Handling Sensitive Information in Caregiving
courseDetails.shortDescription: Best Practices for Confidentiality, Consent, GDPR Compliance, Data Security, and Cybersecurity in Healthcare
courseDetails.longDescription:
The digital transformation of healthcare has made sensitive data more vulnerable to breaches. Over 90 % of hospitals and physician practices in developed nations use Electronic Health Records (EHRs), centralizing vast amounts of data, which increases the risk of breaches. The rise of telehealth, which surged by 3,000 % during the COVID-19 pandemic, continues to generate more digital data that must be managed securely.

Healthcare data is growing exponentially, with a 36 % annual growth rate, and a single patient generating nearly 80 megabytes of data each year.

The cost of data breaches is staggering $10.93 million per incident on average, nearly double the cost in other industries. Human error is responsible for 82 % of breaches, emphasizing the need for caregiver training in secure data handling. With breaches affecting over 133 million individuals in 2023 alone, the need for robust data security practices is urgent. Proper training is essential to protect patient data and mitigate risks.


In modern health and social care, providing excellent patient care is built on a foundation of trust. How you manage and protect sensitive information is critical to maintaining that trust and ensuring patient safety. Are you confident you have the skills to navigate the complex world of data in caregiving?

This essential course empowers every caregiver, social work professional, and healthcare management leader to become a guardian of patient confidentiality. We guide you through the entire information lifecycle, from understanding the Legal & Ethical Frameworks of GDPR to implementing best practices in Record Keeping and Documentation. You will develop crucial skills in Information Governance and Cybersecurity, learning to identify risks and prevent data breaches before they happen.

Master the art of professional Communication and Information Sharing and learn to apply the Code of Practice on Confidential Information in your daily work.


Enroll today and become the trusted, compliant, and confident professional your patients deserve.


What You Will Master in This Course:


  • Module 1: Introduction to Information Handling in Care Begin with the fundamentals by understanding the critical importance of information handling and learning to differentiate between personal, sensitive, and public information in a healthcare setting.

  • Module 2: Legal & Ethical Framework of Information Handling Navigate the complex legal landscape with confidence. We'll demystify the Data Protection Act & GDPR, and explore the core ethical considerations of confidentiality, consent, capacity, and information sharing.

  • Module 3: Record Keeping and Documentation Master the art of accurate and secure documentation. Learn best practices for both paper and electronic health records (EHRs), ensuring your records meet all legal requirements and are completely secure.

Unlock the secrets of professional trading with a course that integrates timeless trading principles, cutting-edge methodologies, and actionable strategies for consistent success. Designed for traders at all levels, this course delves deep into ICT (Inner Circle Trader) concepts, combining the power of Volume Spread Analysis (VSA), Fibonacci retracements, and confluence zones to create a robust trading framework. Whether your focus is options trading, swing trading, or intraday trading, this course equips you with the skills and tools needed to navigate the financial markets with precision and confidence.

What This Course Offers

This course isn’t just about theory—it’s a complete trading system designed to bridge the gap between understanding and execution. You’ll learn to analyze price action like a pro, uncover hidden market dynamics through Volume Spread Analysis, and leverage advanced tools like Python for financial analysis and algorithmic trading to stay ahead of the competition.

Core Elements of the Course

1. Understanding Price Action and ICT Principles

Price action forms the backbone of this course, with ICT concepts providing the advanced tools needed to decode market movements. You’ll learn to:

  • Identify shifts in market structure, including higher highs, higher lows, and reversals.

  • Recognize liquidity zones, Fair Value Gaps (FVGs), and Order Blocks (OBs) to pinpoint institutional activity.

  • Use Smart Money strategies to align your trades with the big players, ensuring a competitive edge.

2. Volume Spread Analysis (VSA): Decoding Market Behavior

Volume is the lifeblood of financial markets, and understanding its interplay with price action is key to trading success. This course introduces you to Volume Spread Analysis (VSA), an advanced methodology that reveals market intent through volume and price movement. You’ll learn to:

  • Identify accumulation and distribution phases where institutions quietly build or offload positions.

  • Detect hidden buying or selling pressure within candlestick formations.

  • Integrate VSA insights with other technical tools to enhance your trade setups.

3. Mastering Fibonacci Tools and Confluence Zones

Fibonacci retracements are a cornerstone of advanced technical analysis, helping traders anticipate price levels with uncanny accuracy. This course teaches you to:

  • Use Fibonacci levels to identify potential reversal zones and profit targets.

  • Align Fibonacci retracements with confluence zones—areas where multiple factors, such as support, resistance, and trendlines, come together to increase the probability of success.

  • Apply these techniques in both swing trading and intraday trading for maximum impact.

4. Precision in Intraday and Swing Trading

Tailored strategies for intraday trading and swing trading ensure you’re equipped to tackle any market condition. You’ll learn to:

  • Leverage ICT’s Kill Zones and time-based setups for high-probability intraday trades.

  • Analyze multi-timeframe charts to uncover lucrative swing trading opportunities.

  • Combine price action, VSA, and Fibonacci to build a multi-dimensional trading strategy.

5. Algorithmic Trading with Python

In today’s markets, automation is essential for staying competitive. This course integrates Python for finance, enabling you to:

  • Automate ICT strategies, including Fair Value Gaps, volume-based setups, and Fibonacci retracement analysis.

  • Backtest and optimize your trading systems using historical data.

  • Deploy algorithmic trading systems for consistent execution, freeing you from manual processes.

Methodology and Approach

This course is rooted in a practical, hands-on methodology that ensures every concept is backed by actionable steps. Here’s how we do it:

1. Real-World Market Examples

Learn through detailed case studies and real-time chart analysis, ensuring you understand how to apply ICT, VSA, and Fibonacci techniques in live markets.

2. Layered Learning

Each concept builds on the last, starting with foundational principles and advancing to sophisticated strategies like confluence trading and automated systems.

3. Interactive Tools and Exercises

From step-by-step coding tutorials for Python for financial analysis to guided practice in identifying volume patterns, this course ensures you develop real, transferable skills.

4. Risk Management at Every Step

Success in trading isn’t just about making profitable trades—it’s about protecting your capital. This course emphasizes risk management, teaching you to:

  • Calculate risk-reward ratios for every trade.

  • Use position sizing and stop-loss placement effectively.

  • Manage drawdowns and psychological challenges.

Why This Course Stands Out

1. Holistic Approach

By combining traditional methodologies like VSA and Fibonacci with ICT’s advanced tools and the automation capabilities of Python, this course creates a comprehensive trading framework.

2. Versatility Across Markets

The strategies taught are adaptable to Forex, stocks, crypto, and options trading, making this course ideal for traders in any market.

3. Focused on Execution

Unlike many courses that dwell on theory, this program is built for action. From spotting opportunities to managing trades, you’ll learn every step of the process.

Who Should Enroll?

This course is for anyone looking to master the art of trading, including:

  • Beginners eager to build a strong foundation in technical analysis and ICT trading.

  • Experienced traders seeking to integrate advanced tools like Python for algorithmic trading.

  • Professionals who want to elevate their performance in options trading, swing trading, or intraday trading.

Take the Leap

This isn’t just a course—it’s a roadmap to financial independence. By mastering price action, Volume Spread Analysis, Fibonacci, and algorithmic trading, you’ll gain the confidence to navigate markets with precision and purpose. Whether you’re trading for supplemental income or aiming to become a full-time trader, this course provides the skills, tools, and mindset to succeed.

courseDetails.title: Accounts Receivable in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
courseDetails.shortDescription: SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Accounts Receivable
courseDetails.longDescription:
Khóa học: Accounts Receivable in SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Từ Tổng Quan Đến Chuyên Sâu

SAP S/4HANA Cloud đang trở thành nền tảng quản lý tài chính cốt lõi cho nhiều doanh nghiệp, và việc nắm vững nghiệp vụ Kế toán phải thu (Accounts Receivable - AR) là vô cùng quan trọng. Khóa học này được thiết kế để trang bị cho bạn kiến thức và kỹ năng toàn diện về AR, giúp bạn nâng cao năng lực chuyên môn và mở ra nhiều cơ hội nghề nghiệp.

Tầm quan trọng của SAP:

  • Toàn cầu: Khách hàng SAP tạo ra 87% tổng giao thương toàn cầu ($46 nghìn tỷ). SAP phục vụ 99/100 công ty lớn nhất, 97/100 công ty xanh nhất thế giới, và 80% khách hàng là doanh nghiệp SMEs.

  • Tại Việt Nam: Với hơn 20 năm hoạt động (văn phòng tại Hà Nội & TP.HCM), SAP là đối tác của 4/5 công ty lớn nhất VNR500 và hơn 770 khách hàng (80% là SMEs). SAP cung cấp hơn 26 giải pháp chuyên ngành thông qua hơn 39 đối tác tại Việt Nam.

Khóa học này cung cấp cho người học lộ trình chi tiết để làm chủ phân hệ Accounts Receivable trong SAP S/4HANA Cloud, từ các khái niệm tổng quan về SAP đến các quy trình nghiệp vụ chuyên sâu về AR. Khóa học kết hợp giữa lý thuyết và thực hành, giúp học viên tự tin áp dụng kiến thức vào thực tế công việc.

Khóa học này phù hợp với các đối tượng sau:

  1. Người mới bắt đầu với SAP: Những người chưa có kinh nghiệm SAP, cần kiến thức cơ bản về S/4HANA và quy trình FI để làm việc hiệu quả.

  2. Sinh viên tài chính/kế toán: Sinh viên muốn hiểu ứng dụng thực tế của SAP S/4HANA trong doanh nghiệp và nâng cao năng lực cạnh tranh.

  3. Chuyên viên tài chính chuyển đổi: Chuyên viên kế toán/tài chính muốn chuyển sang dùng SAP S/4HANA, cần làm quen nhanh với hệ thống và các tính năng nâng cao.

  4. Lãnh đạo doanh nghiệp: CEO, CFO và quản lý muốn hiểu cách S/4HANA hỗ trợ quản lý tài chính và ra quyết định kinh doanh.

Khóa học này nằm trong chuỗi các khóa học về SAP Financial Accounting của One Connect, bao gồm:

  • SF01: Kế toán phải thu - AR (Accounts Receivable in SAP S/4HANA Cloud)

  • SF02: Kế toán phải trả - AP (Accounts Payable in SAP S/4HANA Cloud)

  • SF03: Kế toán tài sản - AA (Asset Accounting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud)

  • SF04: Kế toán tổng hợp - GL (General Ledger in SAP S/4HANA Cloud )

Nội dung khóa học SF01 -  Kế toán phải thu (Accounts Receivable - AR) bao gồm các phần chính:

  • Phần 1: Tổng quan về SAP

    • Chào mừng đến với Thế giới SAP!

    • ERP là gì? Tổng quan cho người mới bắt đầu

    • Sức mạnh và Tầm ảnh hưởng của SAP trên toàn cầu

    • SAP là gì? Tại sao SAP lại quan trọng?

    • Các giải pháp SAP ECC và SAP Business ByDesign

    • SAP S/4HANA: Thế hệ ERP thông minh tiếp theo

    • Làm quen với SAP Fiori: Giao diện người dùng hiện đại

    • SAP Business Suite và sức mạnh của Trí tuệ Nhân tạo (AI)

    • Tổng kết và các bước tiếp theo

  • Phần 2: Tổng quan về kế toán phải thu (Account Receivable - AR)

    • AR Overview

  • Phần 3: Quản lý dữ liệu khách hàng

    • Maintaining Business Partner - Customer Master Records

    • Creating a Customer Master Record

    • Creating an Employee

    • Changing/ Displaying a Customer Master Record

    • Displaying Customer List

  • Phần 4: Xử lý hóa đơn và thanh toán - Managing Accounts Receivable Transactions

    • Entering Outgoing Invoices

    • Entering Outgoing Invoices in a Foreign Currency

    • Entering Outgoing Invoices for One-Time Customer

    • Entering Customer Direct Credit Memo

    • Posting with a Reference

    • Uploading Customer Open Items

    • Posting Incoming Payments - Standard

    • Posting a Manual Incoming Payment with Difference: Partial / Residual item

    • Reset Cleared Items

  • Phần 5: Báo cáo và phân tích

    • Viewing Accounts Receivable Overview

    • Viewing Customer Balances

    • Viewing Customer Line Item

    • Viewing Overdue Receivables

  • Phần 6: Kiểm tra kiến thức

    • Quiz

Khóa học SF01 phù hợp với nhiều đối tượng học viên, từ người mới bắt đầu đến chuyên gia tài chính và lãnh đạo doanh nghiệp, những người có nhu cầu tìm hiểu và làm việc hiệu quả với phân hệ Accounts Receivable trong SAP S/4HANA Cloud.
targetAudiences: Sinh viên các ngành công nghệ, kinh tế, các cá nhân muốn tìm hiểu về SAP S/4HANA để nâng cao khả năng cạnh tranh trên thị trường lao động và mở rộng cơ hội nghề nghiệp.
Những người muốn tìm hiểu về SAP S/4HANA từ đầu để có thể tham gia vào các dự án triển khai hoặc sử dụng hệ thống trong công việc.

Lãnh đạo doanh nghiệp muốn tìm hiểu cách S/4HANA vận hành để áp dụng vào chiến lược và quản lý hoạt động doanh nghiệp, bao gồm Giám đốc điều hành (CEO), Giám đốc tài chính (CFO), Giám đốc CNTT (CIO) và các cấp quản lý khác trong doanh nghiệp.
Các chuyên viên kế toán, tài chính đang làm việc tại các doanh nghiệp sử dụng các hệ thống kế toán khác và có nhu cầu chuyển đổi sang sử dụng SAP S/4HANA.
Người mới bắt đầu làm việc với SAP S/4HANA phân hệ Tài chính kế toán.

courseDetails.title: Large Language Models
courseDetails.shortDescription: LLMs के core concepts, applications, fine-tuning, deployment, और ethics को समझकर शक्तिशाली AI-driven solutions बनाएं।
courseDetails.longDescription:
क्या आप Large Language Models (LLMs) की दुनिया में गहराई से उतरने और उनकी असली क्षमता को अनलॉक करने के लिए तैयार हैं? चाहे आप एक beginner हों या एक developer जो AI के नवीनतम पहलुओं में महारत हासिल करना चाहते हैं, यह कोर्स आपके लिए डिज़ाइन किया गया है।

"Large Language Models" एक समग्र गाइड है जो आपको सबसे शक्तिशाली natural language processing मॉडल्स का उपयोग करके AI applications को समझने, बनाने और तैनात करने में मदद करेगा। LLMs AI solutions का अभिन्न हिस्सा बनते जा रहे हैं, और इन्हें मास्टर करना किसी भी व्यक्ति के लिए एक महत्वपूर्ण कदम है जो इस क्षेत्र में excel करना चाहता है।

इस कोर्स में, आप:

  • LLMs के architecture और foundational concepts को समझने के लिए एक मजबूत आधार प्राप्त करेंगे।

  • अपना खुद का मॉडल बनाने के लिए आवश्यक तकनीकों जैसे tokenization, vectorization, और model training को सीखेंगे।

  • Pre-trained models को specific use cases जैसे text summarization, generation, और classification के लिए Fine-tune करेंगे।

  • LLMs को लोकल और APIs के माध्यम से deploy करेंगे, जिससे आप scalable, real-world AI applications बना सकेंगे।

  • Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) जैसे उन्नत सिस्टम बनाना सीखेंगे, जो data processing और querying को बेहतर बनाएगा।

  • LLMs के real-world applications और ethical considerations को समझेंगे।

LLMs के बारे में क्यों सीखें?

  • Navigating ATT&CK Matrices: Dive into the ATT&CK matrices to map out adversary techniques across different stages of the attack lifecycle.

Next, we delve into MITRE ATLAS:

  • Introduction to MITRE ATLAS: Learn how MITRE ATLAS expands upon ATT&CK and its unique role in threat intelligence.

  • Pyramid of Pain in ATLAS: Understand the concept of the Pyramid of Pain in the context of MITRE ATLAS and its role in threat mitigation.

  • ATLAS Tactics & Techniques: Learn the tactics and techniques used in MITRE ATLAS to map and analyze adversary behavior.

  • Exploring ATLAS Sub-Techniques: Dive deeper into ATLAS sub-techniques to enhance your defensive strategies.

  • Mapping Tactics, Techniques, and Sub-Techniques in ATLAS: Develop a clear understanding of how to map and correlate tactics, techniques, and sub-techniques within the ATLAS framework.

  • Mitigation Strategies in ATLAS: Learn how to apply effective mitigation strategies within the context of MITRE ATLAS.

  • Hands-On: MITRE ATLAS Framework Demo: Get hands-on experience with MITRE ATLAS through a practical demo to apply your knowledge.

Why focus on MITRE ATT&CK and MITRE ATLAS? These frameworks provide a structured approach to understanding and defending against cyber threats, enabling you to respond smarter and faster. By mastering these frameworks, you’ll be equipped to enhance your organization’s cybersecurity posture and become a key player in threat detection and defense.
